title: Data Science in R
text: What is being a data scientist about? What is the difference between a data scientist and a statistician? - List the differences How do I view myself in relation between the two areas?

title: Data Science in R
text: What is being a data scientist about? What is the difference between a data scientist and a statistician? - List the differences How do I view myself in relation between the two areas?

title: Data Science in R
text:
Running Code
Creating new object y to store the density of the Petal width data within the built-in data set Iris.

y <- density(iris$Petal.Width)

Determining the class, type of, and structure of the object y

class(y)

[1] "density"

typeof(y)

[1] "list"

str(y)

List of 7
 $ x        : num [1:512] -0.656 -0.648 -0.64 -0.633 -0.625 ...
 $ y        : num [1:512] 0.00163 0.0018 0.00199 0.00219 0.00241 ...
 $ bw       : num 0.252
 $ n        : int 150
 $ call     : language density.default(x = iris$Petal.Width)
 $ data.name: chr "iris$Petal.Width"
 $ has.na   : logi FALSE
 - attr(*, "class")= chr "density"


We can see that y has the class of density and it is a list of seven variables.
Plotting y





The density of iris petal width is plotted.
